text: Such a great beer. Super complex but everything is in perfect harmony. White whine character is mellow and peasant. The sourness is nice and not overly acidic.

This is my perfect beer - I can find no fault. Crisp, delicious, beautiful to look at. Sour, fruity, funky, plus a little Chardonnay wood. The best of the (amazing) Russian River lineup of wild/belgian/cask aged styles.

From bottle thanks to Maxi. Pours a slight hazy yellow with a Big White head. Aroma has quite estery yeast, funk, oak, sweetish White Wine, very fruity. Taste is super oaky, sour, smooth and spicy. Fluffy, velvety texture and an average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Maxi. Pours hazy bright orange with a small white head. Aromas of brett, pineapple, citrus, mango, estery. Taste is super oaky, grapey, bretty, crackers, peach, tart and light bitter finish. Very delicious.
Bottle from a friend. Tart, fruity smell, funky with wood and some earthy aroma. Similar taste. Very nice! Love the funk and the tartness.

Pours cloudy orange with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of citrus, funk, green grapes, green apples, dew grass, kiwi, oakgooseberry, elderberry, light stable. Taste is sour and very fruity with a strong oak character and some earthy tone. Mouthfeel is dry and tart with medium carbonation and body.

Pours milky hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas lovely tart of lemon, green grapes, lemon zest, oak, hints of barnyard 
Taste has tart and funky notes of lemon zest, green grapes, hints of green apples, oak , citrusy fruits 
Mouthfeel is tart, medium carbonated, no bitterness, dry. Very very nice sour
On tap at ABV Pub in Hillsboro, OR. Clear golden straw. Aroma and taste of funk and fruits. Dry. Lingering funky finish.
Great Sour Blonde Ale, Poured from a 12oz belgian corked bottle. Hazy blonde, perfect sourness
Bottle at home. Almost clear bright golden with a quite big white head. Earthy and dry, funky and sour. Notes from barnyard, chardonnay and oak, in combination with a nice and fresh fruitiness.

Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aroma of peach, mango, funky, grapes, oak, vinous notes, very balanced between sourness and funkyness. Taste is rather fruity with loads of dry wood, slight peach. Dry and subtle sourness.
Så langt fra tæsk og torsdag som man kan komme! Balanceret, ypperlig lækker kombination af funk og smoothness, a la James Brown.

375ml bottle @ Craig Bay. Vintage 2016.05.06 Pours a hazy medium yellow colour with a nice white head. Nose is sour, citrus, lemon, and some wood character. Flavour is just yum! Light sourness, certainly the associated funk, all the while the chardonnay character adds a great balance to it all.
Pours a bright and hazy golden color sour aroma and very tart flavors definitely a strong chardonnay and slight oak flavors

Thanks to my man Mike for this outstanding brew! Une bière que je rêve de déguster depuis fort longtemps et que je moffre ce soir comme ça. Pif pouf. Sans raison particulière. Le moment était venu. Robe cristalline pétillante dune myriade de fines bulles, lui donnant la vigueur dun feu de bengale. La mousse est généreuse, cossue, fière et accueille mon visage tout entier que je plonge dans mon ballon pour en respirer les arômes. Le Chardonnay, le raisin vert, le funk précis, la bois, la sagesse... Cest merveilleux tant tout est parfaitement cohérent, balancé et savamment tissé. 7,5% dalcool? Jamais je nen ressens la moindre molécule tant cette boisson est fine et délicate. Une effervescence minérale adoucie par la barrique beurrée ayant accueillie le Chardonnay que je suis à la trace. Un jus de raisin vert juste assez sûr au corps divin. Ce produit est tout simplement merveilleux!
floral, barnyard, pale, golden, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter, long finish,
Shared bottle, poured a hazy yellow colour with a white head. Nose of soft grains, light vineous, oak, citrus fruits, dry tannis notes, grapefruit. Dry soft tart aftertaste. Overhyped? Ok brew
MEGA lambikowe. Bardzo owocowe, taniczne, delikatne, subtelnie kwaśne. Znakomite. W ciemno mógłbym pomylić z gueuze z Cantillon.
Bottle shared at Chmielarnia. Great fruity and lambic like aroma. Taste is balanced sour, dry, slight sweet. In flavor funky, fruity, soil, wine, wood. Tarty aftertaste. One of best us Sours.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel RR Rami Rami is drinking a Temptation by Russian River Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaTaki lambik. Z biala porzeczka i agrestem. Umiarkowanie kwasny, dosc duzo tanin... wytrawny. Robi wrazenieOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Low fluffy white lasting head. Hazy yellow body. Acicic to sour fruity grapefruit aroma and flavor. Low carbonation. Long finish.

Bottle into a wineglass showing moderately filtered neon yellow with quickly dissipating foam lacing. 


The nose shows clean chardonnay - lemon meringue, light citrus. 

The palate is well carbonated and light bodied. Lightly tart with light citric zest around the edges. Light white wine bitterness on the finish.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 2010 Bottle thanks to Mike. Pours a clear yellow color no head. Smells like truffle peach and old sweat. Slight butter flavor. Very light mouthfeel and light sourness.

This is one off the bucket list. Thanks Rob. By far the driest beer I've ever had. Some unique flavours, including pickle juice. Medicine. Herbs. Herbal medicine. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear classic golden pour with nearly no head. Tart nose. Tart flavor. Blah.
Bottle, about a year old, from Michael (misterburd) -- many, many thanks! Fruity, funky, and bitter, this is a great funky Belgian thats being made the old-fashioned way in California.

Tasted from draft. Pours a very pale light yellow. Clear with some lacing. Aroma is Brett, lemon, citrus, funk. Taste is pretty bitter with flavors of citrus, sour funk, grass and herbal notes. I'll admit I'm not a sour fan but this is well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Batch 2 bottle shared by Karl Meyer thanks. No head. Clear golden color. Big brett aroma and nice complementing acidity. Fresh even though 10 years old.

Bottle from NickD717 simply because hes a good dude and he noticed Id never had it before. Thanks bud!  Beautiful aroma of white wine grapes, yeast, funk, and a little citrus fruit. Pours a clear yellowish-orange with just a hint of a green tint. Fairly bubbly in the glass with a thick white head and some rather heavy, sticky lacing on the glass. The flavor is funky and a little tart. Strong wine component melds beautifully with the funk. Feels fairly soft and yet somehow tingly at the same time, with a dry, funky close. Really excellent stuff. Just another way that our 20+ years of friendship has paid off for my beer drinking pleasure. Thanks again Nick!

Bottle to a snifter. Pours clear pale yellow with ample foamy white head... A ton of carbonation... Effervescent ... Tart apple and white grape notes, pleasantly sour Granny Smith and buttery Chardonnay flavors kissed by the oak... Truly outstanding ale!!!

Hazy straw with a good head and a little bit of retention.. sorta looks like a slightly cloudy sparkling wine.

Aroma is like a dry white wine.. citrus zest.. underripe peaches and grapes.. 

Flavor mirrors the aroma.. sour and fruity and a little oakey.. never reaching acedic territory.. wonderful and very complex... has a puckering quality like when sucking on grape skins and seeds. Body is champagne like with prickly carbonation... and the drinkablity is fantastic... I would pick this over any sparking wine any day, any where, and any circumstance.. awesome.
Light golden color, lots of carbonation. Thick white head. Complex smell, sour with light airyness of white wine. Sour full body. Overall excellent.
Tap @ Monks, Zwanze. Clear gold, lasting white head. Aroma is heavy oak, egg, sock, lemon, light booze, brett. Flavor is dry, tart, brett/lemon/oak/grape/wine.
What can I say that hasnt been said already, if you get a chance to drink this beer, do it you wont be sorry another great sour from these guys.
Draft - Vintage 2012 - Nice sweet perfumy grains. Clear gold with a decent white head. Nice, sweet and Pedrumy with a clean light tart finish. Solid.

Draft at Fire on the Mountain, Denver. Clear gold, with moderate lacing. Nose is some sweaty brett, light tropical fruits, with some basement and minerality, white wine. Taste follows, all very subtle with nice lemon and light lacto tartness on the finish. Very smooth and drinkable, not beating you over the head with any one thing.

Look: almost clear yellow with strong white head.

Aroma: white grape, brett, cider, some spicy herbs.
Taste: dry, lactic acidity with astrigency and bitterness.
Flavour: white wine, fresh grape, yeast, brett, lactic acid, oak tannins,
Prominent bitterness in the aftertaste.

Very good.
Tap at the source. Pours light yellow, big white head. Aroma is sour funk, lemon, clove, light oak character. Flavor is tart lemon, spicey earthiness. Very well done.
Bottle. Pours light yellow golden. Aroma is white grapes and citrus. Taste is sweet citrus / Bret up front with a dry sour wine finish. Nothing really not to like about it.

Corked and caged 6/2014 bottle from Waterboy, thanks Ric! Shared with ck1 during the Spit Cup/2000th weekend. Wine cooler colored pour. Tangy. Fruity. Brett with funk. Quite wine-ish. Very smooth and tasty. 16.4
Tap at russian river, santa rosa. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma has sour peaches and lemons, some sweet but some hoppy also. Sour taste, peaches and apples, lemon.
Tasty, enjoyable and light, not overbearing...very friendly. Easy enough to drink, good to sip but I dont want the whole bottle  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Review from notes. Golden color with white head. Aroma is tart and you get the barrel character along with some yeasty funk. Taste is sour, fruity, acidic and dry. Grape flavor is quite intense. Body is dry but somehow smooth and well carbonated. Really nice, clean and fruity sour ale.
Bottle to glass. Pours a deep yellow color with an off white head. Aroma is dry, tart, tingles the nostrils. Flavor is massively sour, funk, citrus, grapes. Excellent.

Bottle to RBAG goblet...thanks Willie
Lemon, funk, yeast, apricot. Cloudy, light yellow, thin white head. Funk, holy funk, lemon. Damn...this is good.
Bottle at the DC Mini Tasting. Murky yellow orange with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, funk, citrus. Tastes of lemon citrus, herbs, tart notes. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Wonderful stuff. Citrus, and some apricot. Golden pour and some head. Some peel. Light tangy finish. Great beer but seems like somewhat of a legacy rating. Light tangy finish. Bottle big thanks to Travlr.
Bottle shared by Andy. Light golden cloudy pour. Strong tart aroma of apples. Apple skin and tart fruits. Really good stuff.

Bottle. Light hazy deep golden liquid with minimal white head. Aroma of lemon, apple skin, cunty taste, jungle fever, grain, oxidization, light funk and wood. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of apple skin, lemon, light wood, light vinegar and light grain. Light to medium bodied with low carbonation. Really nice! Wouldve preferred more carbonation.

Merci à Mario Hernandez pour cette maudite belle chance. Bottled on: 080315. Superbe et complexe nez avec des agrumes, dautres fruits tropicaux, du vin blanc, du bois mangé par les bons microbes et du foin. Très près de la perfection. Au goût, un mélange très agréable de notes de raisins aigres, de jus de pamplemousse, de spontanéité, de chêne et de vanille. Fantastique. En bouche, un liquide souple qui est parfaitement sculpté pour mon palais. La finale impressionnante est boisée, aigre et fruitée. Tellement facile à boire. Du grand art. Finalement.
375 ml bottle at home, thanks TimVim! Cloudy golden with white head. Aroma vinous, barrel, funk, grapes, lemon, zest. Taste is vinous, sour, barrel, wood, funk, grape juice. Really nice!

It s not a Cantillion, I am not going to rate on style in comparison but merely on the merits of the brew. You Americans always tweak things. And this one was a great tweak. Younger tasting than the Cantillions. That said the Vinicius character in this brewerys beer is really a great dimension to mellow out the sometimes harsh oak. The slight Brett is evident and the acidic tartness is well in balance. Love the mouthfeel and carbonation. Great if not a perfect brew.

Btl pours crystal clear golden color with a soft compact white head. It vanished quickly leaving a ring of foam and spots of lace. Aromas of wood, grape juice, funk( wet horses) and citrus fruit. Taste of white grapes,lemon sour patch kid candy and a hint of wine. Medium body, soft silky mouthfeel, above average carbonation with a tingling on the tongue dry finish.  Absolutely wonderful tasting sour beer. This beer is addicting. I love the sour taste, its perfect. RR never disappoints. Well done!

Pours a pale golden color with a white head. Tart, funk, yeast, fruit, wood and grape must aroma. Funk, tart, wood, white wine, yeast, biscuit, fruit, grape must and biscuit flavors. Medium light body and lively carbonation. Funk, grape must and tart finish.
Sour grapes! Love it white wine and oak. Malts are evident but the flavor of wood and white wine complex this out. Nice fizz like a sparkling wine. Finished with cellar notes of an old winery.

Bottle in Boca before leaving. Small snifters with Dan and Brian. Pours a golden clear with a small head. The aroma is fucking heaven with white wine grape must, balanced oak barrel, just the right amount of brett. The taste is just as impressive with white wine, white grapes, must, brett funk, straw, and the oak barrel. The aging makes it so smooth regarding tartness. Active carb, light body. Just overall wonderful.
Awesome in everything from lemon zest and wine barrel aroma. Taste real tart with a wine like champagne Chardonnay mouthfeel. Finishes with tartness and funk. Excellent.
Golden orange color with a thick white head. Aromas of fruits, lemon, leather and oak. Taste is really sour and acidic, with lemon, leather, sweat, oak, fruits. Light body with medium carbonation.

2011 vintage 375 ml mottle into snifter. Pours a clear stunning gold color with small off white head that sticks to the sides of the glass. Nose is bit white wine, minerals, apples, lemon zest, hints of horse blanket, straw, biscuit. Light body, mild sweetness, soft carbonation, sharp acidity, moderate funk, slight sourness. Finish is long lasting with more acidic apple, and vinous notes. I get a lot of chardonnay here, and it really aged beautifully with great level of funk and sourness coming through, very well crafted beer.
Rated based on notes taken 14 May 2012 -- Bottle (5X1E) poured into an English pint. This beer is great. This started molding my enjoyment of sour beers.

Aroma is floral, grass, citrus, earthy...Appearance is pale, with a hazy and cloudy look to the brew. Slight head that disappeared. Taste was amazing, medium sweetness, then the sourness hits...you can taste the barrel aging in this very well. Long finish, lingers around. Matches well with so many different foods. High carbonation, slick and easy to drink, great mouthfeel, and full bodies. A delight to drink.

Bottle: Golden-yellow body, bright & hazy with a stark white, foamy head that settles quickly to a thin collar. Aroma of thoroughly acidic & tart. Sour apple skins, pears, under-ripe stone fruit, faint apricot. Heavy wood backdrop; lots of wet oak, dusty hay, dry white wine, & sour grapes. Super sour flavor loaded with puckering tartness. Lemons, apples, pears, & acidic peach transforms into a softer vinousness near mid-palate loaded with white wine, acetic grapes, faint vinegar, & a strong background of woody oak. Small touch of cotton blanket funk & musty hay. Sour lingers in the finish with an aftertaste of white grapes, lemon, apple, wood, & faint vinegar. Just a delicious beer, absolutely incredible. My favorite Russian River sour behind Beatification.

Is it beer or wine. Either or it would be a five. Nice Pinot and Sauvignon blanc aroma, beer character of an old lambic, tart and sour. Both the flavors and aromas of peach and sour fruits are excellent.
This beer has a lot going on. Chardonnay is evident in the nose, as is the oak. So lemon, grape, floral notes, funky sourness that is lovely. Soft carbonation.

Au nez, c'est bien sûr, barriqué et sucré à la fois. En bouche, c'est très surette, mais sucré comme un bonbon a la fois. On sent bien le vieillissement en baril. Ce n'est pas poussiéreux, mais plutôt léger et pétillant. La finale est sweet, sour et citrusy! Un cadeau des dieux!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml corked bottle. White wine grape aroma with notes of sour funk and a bit of lemony citrus. Pours clear golden colored with a thin, retentive white head with excellent lacing. Starts quite like a Chardonnay with sweet white grape flavors coupled with the lively carbonation. Finishes smooth but quite tart with funk and some lemon citrus that lingers on the palate. Very good, but the sour bite at the end is a bit much for my tastes.
Sour funk and oak in aroma, wine like in flavor champagne like in carbonation. Taste tart lemon and dark grape sour grape. Really good brew if this is your style!

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 4 2014; eye: golden, clear, no effervescence, tiny ring of off-white head, light lacing; nose: acidity, sourness, wild yeasts, musk, fruity, freshness; mouth: acidity, sourness, wild yeasts, musk, fruity, freshness, refreshing, finale in musk with presence of acidity, medium-full body, good carbonation, slick texture; overall: nice balance
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 4 octobre 2014; il : dorée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petit anneau de mousse blanc cassé, légère dentelle; nez : acidité, aigreur, levures sauvages, musc, fruité, fraîcheur; bouche : acidité, aigreur, levures sauvages, musc, fruité, fraîcheur, rafraîchissante, finale en musc avec présence dacidité, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, texture coulante; en résumé : bel équilibre

Pours a straw color, pretty hazy, carbonation fizzling to the top, lots of white head that clings to the glass and leaves a good bit of lacing. Smells kind of like a chardonnay with some brett, grass, funk and sourdough bread. The taste is of vinegar, lemon, grape, funk, and a tad bit of bread on the finish. Very sour, carbonation tingles the tongue, drying, astringent qualities. Overall great beer, not the best sour in the world but unique and worth a try
Pours golden yellow with thin white head. Smell is white wine, funk and vinegar. Taste is sour with notes of white wine, oak, lemon and vinegar. Light body, heavy carb.
Had on draft at the brewery. I got grapes, lemon, acidic, dusty, grain, thin finish. Not bad.

Sours are not my favorite style, and Im certainly no expert on them but this one is pretty damn good. Smells like a chardonnay and the first sip tastes like it too, but then you get the sour with the wine. Nice fine carbonation, good mouth feel.
Batch 003 bottle shared. Pours a transparent amber with a thin layer of off white head. Aroma and taste of oak and tart with ample carbonation.

Bottle at home, bought from RRBC. Bottled June 2014. Clear yellow gold, fluffy white head recedes gently. Nose of heavy brett funk, lemon, hay, light cheese, floral perfume. Tastes a touch sweet cereal then heavy sour, vinous, green apple, lacto acidity, dry and buttery oak, some moderate bitterness, touch of funk. Medium body, lightly creamy feel, sharpish fine carb, long sour apple and cheesy finish. If anything this is better than on draft, superb.
Scent is lemon and major funk, flavor reflects that with slight pink peppercorn. Amazing beer.

Yields a sunny-yellow color, with a one finger broad, bubbly head.

The aromas reveal a tart sourness among wheat notes. It got an almost sweeter sparkling wine character with a noteable barrel infusion to it, which then turns into a more acidic direction. It picks up on the lactic chardonnay characteristic very well, the resulting tartness comes almost naturally to mind. The nose gets completed by hints of white lemon peel, adding a refreshing, fruity aspect.

While the sourness from the aromas was very well integrated into a complex interplay of smells, it shines through big time while tasting the beer. It rises from the sweeter, pungent sparkling wine qualities to unfold on the palate with an almost tongue numbing dryness. The sweeter aspect doesnt vanish from one moment to the other, but evolves during drinking and turns from sweet to sour, while the lively, soft carbonation turns visible. Funkiness is very well integrated, adding depth to the chardonnay lactic acid, without being recognizable on its own, otherwise defined by its typical barnyard qualities. Due to the high carbonation, the mouthfeel is almost sprizzy, fizzy - another well inserted sparkling wine aspect.

I am impressed, that this is still easily recognizable as a beer, while it features very thoughtful and effectively integrated sparkling wine constituents. Malts and hops play an important role, as they prevent the beer from becoming too sweet and fizzy. The subtle musty and earthy additions do the same, convincing me this is still beer. Finishes quite refreshing with a faint lemon fruitiness and an almost bitter, punching, dry sourness. This is incredibly complex and very convincing.

16 Nov 2014, bottle. light yellow, clear, steady bubbles. nose is brett, white grape, grape must. thin body and moderately fizzy. pretty tart from the beginning and fades at the end. earthy, dry, some woody notes. reminds me of a dry champagne.

Golden clear with a big white head but it disappeared quickly. Very aroma, some hay and funkiness. Taste is very fruity, Brett and lactic sourness, maybe the best RR sloe Ive tried yet, really enjoying this.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Pours a hazy yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma is sour lemon, funky brett, nice barnyard over lactic citrus. Taste follows, nice lactic tartness with big funky barnyard notes, citrus base, prefect for what you would think.

A more pronounced sour. Citrus and apple tart aroma. Pretty crystal golden color with a big foamy head. Palate was very wine-like. Tartness was up front and more like apple than lemon. Finish was somewhat dry. The funk was a little less. A little more one-sided than I typically prefer.

On tap at Russian River. Pours a pale yellow with a small white head that dissipates quickly. The aroma has a huge tart apple and grape, vinegar, light oak. The taste is big tart lemon, apple, and grape. There is a residual dry tartness that lingers on the tongue.
Chardonnay smell and taste. Lots of oak and bubbles. Medium to high carbonation and foamy.

"ok, Russian River knows what theyre doing with the Belgian style. This is one of the better ones Ive tried. Ive only had it on tap...hopefully, as its corked, its just as good in the bottle. A little pricey, but worth trying. had for the third time last night-just a sample, but its grown on me a little (not that i didnt like it before). the brett & barreling seemed more aggressive this time, which was a good thing. near mouth-puckering yuminess."

Pours a golden slightly hazy. Very little head that quickly dissipates. Aromas of tart citrus with hints of oaks. Characters of white wine and brett also come through. Flavors of chardonnay with a definite sour punch. Very dry and tart with a oaky finish. Extremely complex and very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild and balanced fruity, dried tropical fruits, grapefruit, sorrel, oak, mild vinegar, light malts, lemon, peach. Taste is slightly dry citrusy, lemon peel, oak, sorrel, mild vinegar, grass, lemon, weeds, hay.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of Chardonnay, sour fruits and apples. Tastes of sour grapes, yeast and Chardonnay. No aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375 ml, bottled on 6/18/14, purchased at RR. Clear gold with fizzy carbonation with thin head in a snifter. Served slightly chilled at 49 degrees. Aroma is white wine, oak and mild Brett.
Flavor has lots of white wine throughout. Lightly tart with a precancerous of yeast. Turns sour in the back end, with nice oak character. The carbonation a lividly zing over the tongue, great effervescent pop. The texture is dry and crisp with a medium body. Damn! The wine, oak and Brett are married together in a beautiful threesome. If you know me and my feelings on sours, you will understand how much this impresses me; based on my score.

08.10.2014, 0,375l bottle (2012 vintage) sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice slightly bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild and balanced fruity, dried tropical fruits, grapefruit, sorrel, oak, mild vinegar, light malts, lemon, peach. Taste is slightly dry citrusy, lemon peel, oak, sorrel, mild vinegar, grass, lemon, weeds, hay. Medium bitterness, slightly dry sour-ish mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours a slightly cloudy orange with a dense white top that laces the glass well. Aroma of wood, grapefruit, orange, dried hay and citruspeel. Citrus dominated flavor, tart and acidic, zesty. Some orange, some tropical fruits. Faint notes of pale malts and old hops. This is a magnificent brew. Dry.

0.375l corked bottle shared with The Tasting Crew from trade with ig88b. Huge thanks for this one! Pours a really good looking, what I will describe as glowing orange cloudy body. It also has a lovely bright white slowly fading and heavy lacing head on the top. Tartish woody nose with lots of sour fruity elements. White currants, sharp sorrel, bitter orange peel, almost a little tropical in a way? It smells absolutely lovely non the less. Really flavorful also! Oh, yeah. It has a nice oily feeling in the mouth and its spot on the carbonation. The first thing I get in the taste is dried apricots. Ill actually call it super-fruity this. The sourness is just perfectly balanced between the tart woody, the fruity sweet and and the sharp vinegar - stingy. Definitely a little wood hint here, citrus and citrus peel. What a lovely beverage. Moreish, refreshing and just plain old lov ly tasting. 08.10.2014

Poured at GABF and drank there too!! Awsome beer, pretty sour but I really enjoyed the grape must character. I loved the oak balance and the dry crisp finish with its champagne like bubbles. Perfect brew.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Medium sourness. Wild yeast flavors. Easy going sour.

Bottle dated 5/30/13. Pours a glowing pale gold with almost no head. Aroma is sour apricots, preserved lemon, musty cork, minerally Sancerre, white grape juice, peach, light funk. Profoundly winelike and complex. Taste is sweet peach and white grape on the front of the tongue that sharply pivots into clean sour apples, lemon juice, and buttery Chardonnay with oak barrel tannins. Sits in your mouth and changes, lingering and evolving. Prickly Champagne-like carbonation. Perhaps a bit more sour than Id like, but nonetheless the work of a master.
Pours blonde yellow, white head. Aroma is tart, white grapes. First taste is sour and citrusy. Finishes with herbs and bitterness. Delicious

Bottle. This one was turning into a bit of whale for me; I meant to rate it earlier, but it didn?t show up in Portland for a couple of years.A: Opaque orange-gold, a thin white ring of head. Some good lacing. N: Lemon, chardonnay, heaps of funk and attic floorboards, and a touch of melon. Grapefruit and pine through and through, as if this was an IPA. Oak and green apple. T: Very sour. A touch of biscuit at the base of this, but it?s definitely acidic. M: Big biting carbonation. light body, no alcohol presence. Desiccating. O: Been awhile since I?ve had this one, but I don?t remember it being this intense. The brett and the acidity is there, and I think this one is well worth its place in the American sour pantheon. Wish other places could get their beer so clean.
On tap at Hops and Pie. Golden pour. Nose of funk, chardonnay, and oak. Sour, with a full backbone of wine and oak that finishes clean.
Smells of fruit with a hint of wine in the background. Light golden color. Taste is a little funky but balanced. Tastes a bit like wine. Highly carbonated mouthfeel. Overall very good.
Definitely the Chardonnay of beers. Not too sour for enjoying as a boozy session ale.

Draught at Russian River. Golden color, white head. Bitter/sour taste with citrus, peach, chardonnay, hops, grass, earthy notes and ripe fruits. Bitter finish with citrus, grape, earthy notes and hops. Excellent sour/wild ale.

Bottle. Hazy gold/orange with a thin snow white head. Aroma is apricot, citrus, a little rubbing alcohol and musty/cheesy funk. Taste adds some lactic notes and white wine barrel. Medium spritzy palate. Excellent.

Bottle. Bright yellow gold. Funky yeast aroma with white wine. Sour tart taste that fades to sweet sugar with a lingering bite on the sides of the tongue. Excellent! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sampler @ RR. Golden colour. Citrus chardonay aroma. Funky delicous sourness.

End of day beer, gardens at Stone. 

Temptation - Russian River 
BA wild ale 
7.5% ABV 

APPEARANCE: Pours a kings crown gold with a brilliant star-bright glow coming from the bottom of the glass. Small thin white soapy head that dissipates into a halo that stays the entire time I'm drinking. 

AROMA: Beautiful bouquet on this beer, huge sour tartness initially with loads of lemon and hay blended together. Perfectly ripe green apples, grapes, white wine notes and oakiness. 

TASTE: My taste buds are playing celestial trumpets. A perfect marriage of sweet and sour. Like drinking a Chardonnay with lemon zest on top. Sour grapes and slightly sweet grassy notes. Nice faint flavors of barrel and malt. 

MOUTHFEEL: Light plus body with a medium dancing carbonation. Funky, dry long lasting finish. 

OVERALL: This beer was the perfect outside right before sunset 75 degree choice. Super refreshing and easy drinking. I am just starting to explore into the world of sours, out of all the RR sours I've had this is by far my favorite. 

RATING: 4.5/5 Zombie Heads!


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: hazy, deep straw, medium head and good lace. Citrus, cheese, loads of fruit. Sour, funky notes. Dry to off dry, sour and low to medium bitterness. Dense and long. Loads of flavor. Clean Brett. 
Wonderful balance. Lots of citrus rind. High carbonation.
Old Rating - Gold and bubbly. Strong aroma of wine barrels and oak. Taste has a wine, grape, lemon, and plenty of barnyard funk. Dry and sour finish. Pretty high carbonation and medium bodied.

Bottle at Beechners Blind Bash. Thanks to DrewFace. Faint cider like aroma (could be the beer next to it though, as it turned out). A strong lemon aroma and taste. A chest thumping acidic punch in the flavor/mouthfeel. A bit herbal and spicy. Overall enjoyable.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy translucent dark yellow with orange hues. Head dissipates quickly, leaving light lacing. Aroma is funky barnyard notes with straw and wood. Flavor is sour with many flavors coming together: Brett, oak, wine-like tannins, fruity complexity, the list goes on. Delicious. From notes 1/23/10 (Geist Dark Lord tasting).

Bottle as shown. Pours a clear gold with medium frothy off white head that lasts. The aroma is funk, tart fruit, brett. Thin mouthfeel with nice tart lemon and funk with strong oak. Easy to drink, very impressive.

Clear straw yellow in color with thinnish foamy head... Aroma of dry Chardonnay, lemons, oak, light funk, tartness... Flavor is fairly light, lemon zest, citrus, Chardonnay prevalent, tartness comes through midway, finishes with a dry champagne finish... Mouthfeel is champagne all the way... Really enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is very winey- lots of Chardonnay, fruity, sour, lemon. Taste is medium- sour, very dry, tart, crisp, lots of wine, good.
Clear golden of color with a white head. An aroma of winegum, sour, peach, horseback, spice, oak and exotic. A flavor of peach, sour, horseback, spice, oak and dry.

Poured 2012 from bottle to glass. Hazy orange hue with fizzy white head. Aroma is lactic, oak, white wine, straw, raspberry. Mouthfeel is great with medium light body and fizzy carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a nice tart sourness through the following and finishes clean. Overall this is a great sour with a lot of Chardonnay character.
Bottle share. Batch Q5X1F. Pours clear yellow with minimal cap. Aroma of wood, white wine, citrus and fruit juice, funk. Taste is tart. Crisp a wet finish.

Bottle @ tasting, courtesy of kermis. Pours a hazy golden beer with a medium sized white head on top. Aroma of lemon, apricot, peaches and melon, loads of fruits present. Flavor is medium sour, very crisp and clean. Loads of fruit are back in the flavors, finishes quite dry and tart. Very nice sour, great brew!!

Corked and caged bottle dated 5/30/13 from Homer321. Pours hazy golden colored with a one finger fizzy white head. Sweet and sour aroma, sour vinegar, pears, apples, citrus, hay, dry oak, vinous white wine notes. Flavor is big sour vinegar, juicy apple, tart brett notes, dry oakiness. Medium body with prickly carbonation, smooth and dry finish. Really nice brew.
Very light yellow, white head. Nose is wine barrel, sour light fruits. Taste is wine barrel, sour peaches, nectarine, very complex and delicious. By far my favorite regular release from RR.
Bottle shared. Pours hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma is barnyard funky, citrus, tart fruity, leather. Flavour is light sweet and moderate acidic. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

sample shared.
A thin white head. Cloudy golden blond pour. Funky aroma. A decent sour.
Slight hazy yellow with a good pale head. Aroma is orange zest, brett funk, gooseberry, citrus. Medium bodied, fruity and sour on the palate, dry finish. Taste is orange, brett funk, lemon zest.

Yellow color, small persistent head. Aromas of wild yeasts, wood, lemon, yellow fruits. Flavors of wild yeasts, sour, wood, lemon and tangerine.
Couleur jaune, petit collet de mousse persistant. Arômes de levures sauvages, bois, citron et fruits jaunes. Saveurs de levures sauvages, sure, bois, citron et tangerine.

Approximately 3 oz. pour from 12.7 oz. bottle. Consumed on 4-19-14. Batch 05x2F, which, according to the brewerys website, was brewed on 10/16/2009 and bottled on 7/7/2010, using Abbey Ale Yeast as the primary yeast and Rockpile and Brettanomyces as the conditioning yeast. My mom picked this up for me on a trip to California back in 2010, so I drank it at a little under 4 years old, shared with some fellow RateBeerians (ElGaucho and falco242) at a small tasting. Powerful, Belgian-esque, fresh, sour, fruity aroma features a crabapple scent. Excellent and appetizing sour smell. Pours an effervescent golden with a small amount of beige head. It looks as it should, but Im not going to award such an ordinary appearance particularly high marks. Really nice and quite complex, sour flavor features elements of urine (but not in a bad way, somehow) and sour apple. Nice, dry finish. Lively and frothy in the palate. Temptation, or at least this batch of Temptation, is a sophisticated, complicated, and subtle beer. It is not over the top in its sourness, but it really is exactly what anyone would want out of a sour. A wonderful and well made brew.
Holy crap, this beer is awesome. Light yellow with a remarkable apple and winey oakiness and the brett adds a wondetful tart sourness that doesnt make you pucker too much. So damn good.
Bottle courtesy of Islay. Sour aroma with some funk. Crystal clear pale yellow. Effervescent bubbles. Very sour initial mouthfeel. Dry. Batch 05X2F. Very complex and palate cleansing. Enjoyable.

Draft pour. Lemon tart aroma. Sweet citrus flavors with a nice, dry, mild, sour finish. I can drink this all day, as I could have guessed. Sour isnt nearly as intense as others, but its nice for a change. Loved it.

355 ml corked and caged bottle. From a trade. Pours golden, slightly hazy with a small off white head that settles fast. Aroma is lots of funk, acid, lemonpeel and some hay. Taste is loads of lemon, some light bread and some light vinegar. Quite vineous with a dry ending. Enjoyable!

375 mL bottle, bottled on 5/30/2013. Beautiful pour - crystal clear deep gold with fluffy white long lasting head. Big lacing. Lively carbonation. Nose is somewhat restrained. Aromas of chardonnay, earth, and pie cherries. Flavor is bursting and much more complex. Mostly lemon drop type sour with some tart cherry, funky and musty in all the right ways. Finish is quick and leaves the mouth feeling refreshed and wanting more. Wonderful sour beer, one of the best I've had.

Rated on 4-28-2010 (Corked and caged bottle and Batch 003) This beer pours a large frothy white head that mostly diminishes, transparent/slightly hazy yellow body, fizzy carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The aroma is yeast, woody, buttery, sweet, fruity, sour, and tart. The taste is sweet, sour, tart, fruity, oak, buttery, and has a dry finish. The palate is tingly and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, this beer is very sour tasting and it is too sour for my liking. If one likes this beer style, one should try this one.

On draught at 2014 CellarFest at Baileys Taproom. 2009 vintage. Deep hazy golden color. Lightly funky basement aroma with notes of lemon zest. Taste is funky yeast, green grapes, lemon, oak, and sweet citrus. Mellow sour and fruit balance. Belies its alcohol content.

Bottled on 05/30/13. Amazing yellow color with a thick white head. The funky Chardonnay taste really spills through on this one! Amazing horse blanket smell rocks though as you taste unicorn effervescence. Very refreshing and a must have in the very near future!

Bottle shared by tectactoe at Jeffs. Thanks! Pours light yellow with a small fizzy head that fades to nothing. Musty aroma of citrus, grass, oak, barnyard and white wine. Taste is very woody and earthy. Nice amount of sour lemon, white wine, and funky barnyard. Not overly sour or tart which is good for me. One of the most refreshing sours Ive had and it goes down really easy. Definitely my favorite RR sour Ive sampled.
Bottle->snifter. Hazy golden yellow with bare white head. Brett, bright citrus funk, sour fruit. Very very nice.

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, thank you! Aroma bubblegum, light brett. Lightly salty. Hazy yellow colour. Taste has considerable sourness, but not overpowering. Moderate to high intensity. White wine characteristics present. Refreshing, enjoyable. The wine is going forward with time. Finish of rather short duration. Enjoyable.
Bottle shared thanks to Chris. Pours a murky golden color. Aroma of white wine, grape skins, Brett, some stone fruit. Taste is slightly tart but not overpowering. Lighter body and medium carb.
Bottle pours a straw yellow with a white carbonated head. Funk apples and lemon aroma. Taste is the same.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with little head to speak of. Smells of funk and citrus. Drinks smoothly with lingering sour grapefruit notes. Tastes of citrus, bread, mild funk, great sour bite. Finishes clean.

Bottle, bought in SF in August 2013. 

Hazy golden with a small white. Aroma of brett, oak, hops and apples. The taste was good but not as good as the the aroma. Quite mild with brett, some fruit, oak and yeast. Nicely drinkable.

Ale Alpharetta December Meeting. Maybe time and place and the fact that not but one other sour made it out, but this was the best beer of the day. Citric acid, medium/heavy sour, sour green apple, fruity brett, chardonnay, oak. Wonderful. Bright, tart, dry, brett yumminess.

Another excellent example of a five out of five beer. Balanced and somewhat acidic tart Chardonnay Apple cider vinegar characteristics aroma is pear bready yeast peach and mango. It ends extremely dry carbonated very well perfect brew in my opinion.
Bottle, thanks Paul. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma of white wine, citrus, funk. Taste is lemon, citrus, white wine, funk. Light sourness. Tasty.

375ml bottle (5/13) pours semi-clear golden yellow with a finger of fluffy head. Nose is big woody barrel funk, citrus, fruity yeast, white grape, dank, musty oak. Taste is tart white grape, funky apple, earthy wood, barrel, white wine, peach, tangerine. Finish is fruity sour funk and grape. Fantastic.

Bottle thanks to dbuckingham, thanks man! Pours a hazy dark yellow with a thin white bubbly head and some spotty lacing, aroma is tart at first, but the brett and dryness really comes through as well, the front end of the flavor was much more fruity than I was expecting, with a good amount of funk and some barnyard notes in the finish, pretty tart in the finish but not mouth puckering sour, mouthfeel is light and tingly, the abv is completely hidden, would have thought this was 5%, pretty damn good.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2013 On tap at city beer SF. Pours a straw yellow with a frothy white head. Superb lacing clings to the glass. Aromas of grapes, funk, lemon zest, Chardonnay and biscuit malts. Taste is quite tart up front then settles. Chardonnay like bitterness clings to the palate with a lemon zest making for a refreshing crisp finish. Palate coated in oak from the Chardonnay. Aging has worked a treat - booze is disguised beautifully. World class beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from trade with StefanSD, huge thank you sir .Hazy yellow colored beer with medium white head. Vinous aroma, with apples, funk, barnyard, wood. Very complex taste with sour apples, grapes, grapefruit, lemon, oak,. Tart finish. Tasty, sipper for a long evening.

Poured from bottle. Hazy yellow color. Winy aroma. Sour taste, no bitterness. Some soapy tones. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso, many thanks. Pours hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma is sourish, grapes, red fruits. Taste is sour, white wine, lemon. Nice sourish finish.
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Sour, sour, sour. Excellent! Wine, herbals, vinegar. Not easy to drink due to its sourness. Overall fantastic!

On tap at the brewery, Santa Rosa, pours an orange rusty color without any significant head. Nose is tart and pungent. Taste is a pleasantly tart and pungent an just bathes and puckers the palate. Finishes as it starts with real tartness and pungency. Great sour. Quaff score 8 / 10

On tap at Russian River brewpub in Santa Rosa. Pours a golden yellow with a white head and tart, fruity aroma. Taste is tart and sweet, lots of fruits, cherry, and berries with a sour finish. Excellent sour ale
Tap at Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries and sourness. Nice and soft.

Batch 072512
Pours a light yellow diaphanous with a solid fine white quilt. Smells of lemon, funk, zesty tartness and some nice pithy character. Flavor is sour with a good farmy, tart, hints of bicarb, some bits of pepper and a nicely refreshing finish. Thin with hi carb and watery finish. This might be one of my preferred RR beers. Really a beautiful brew.

Original review 25JAN11
5/4/4/4/4/4.05
Batch 05x1F
A: c&c bottle pops and pours a light golden ale with excellent clarity. Atop is a blanket of white head which is constantly refilled with a continuous persistence of bubbling.
S: Oranges, limes, classic tart scent. Great smell.
T: Tart, farmy, with largely bitter head. Somegrassy tones.Very good.
M: Light body with excellent carbonation. Great feel and finish on the tongue.
D: This beer is wonderful. I can say I prefer supplication to this one. But when available, I still buy it.

Serving type: bottle

11-04-2012

Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - After the live games drinking session... Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Juicy and inviting fruity brett character with just the right funky notes, complex American Sour-style oak and balsamic character, uper complex, dry and tart flavour with funk and oak, citrus, pineapple, oak, coconut and vanilla. A masterpiece

Trad from StefanSD, thanks body. Bottle @ Odense Beer & Ball Saturday - Real Madrid vs. Valladolid. Hazy yellow body with a small whitte head. Brett, citrus, yeast, oak, whitewine, tart, dust, fruity. Dry and crispy. This is a very balanced sour.

Bottle @ Beer & Ball Saturday, Odense. 13,000th Tasting. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Nose is oak complexity, Wood, farmyard, brett, lemon. Tart and dry. Sublimely complex and delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2014 Silver cream, light winey colour. Aroma is mild sour, mild wine. Taste is sharp tang, rich sour, mild wine quality. Very drinkable and approachable - light carbonation, lemon citrus tang and a lovely sour finish. Overall, lovely sour, lots of great complex character. Just a touch too sweet and sticky on the finish but maybe my favourite Russian River sour.

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Bottle, 5/2013. Another banger from RR, I think this is the most gueuze-like of their main sours -- nice. Smell gives me lemon, apple, white wine, oak and more. Taste is moderately sour but well-balanced and full of flavor. Long evolving finish, lively mouthfeel.

Update: 8/2014, aged 5/2013 bottle. Still damn good but different, clear evolution. Blue cheese funk on the nose. Im about it!
Tap at the brewery. Nice sour aroma with some oak. Flavor is oaky sour. Nice beer.
Bottle pours blonde low head, aroma is tart funky, taste is a great mix of tart and funk with a dry finish, love this

375 ml bottle into tulip glass, batch 05X1E. Pours lightly cloudy bright golden amber color with a 2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big tart green apple, grape, pear, lemon zest, straw, hay, grass, oak, clove, pepper, white wine, vinegar, leather, funk, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with big complexity and great balance of yeast ester and wine barrel notes; with good strength. Taste of tart green apple, grape, pear, lemon zest, hay, straw, grass, honey, bread, oak, clove, pepper, white wine, vinegar, leather, funk, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy/fruity tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of green apple, grape, pear, lemon zest, hay, straw, grass, honey, bread, white wine, oak, clove, pepper, leather, vinegar, funk, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity and balance of malt, wine barrel, and yeast ester flavors; with a great malt/tartness balance with zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an outstanding wild ale as expected. Tons of great complexity and well balanced flavors; and very smooth and crisp to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.
Sample at Faux-bab. sour lemon and white wine, has sort of a metallic aftertaste. Reminded me of the New Glarus sour. Good but probably overrated.

375ml into a tulip. Smell is oak, grapes, chardonnay, funk. Taste is super refreshing, sharp funk up from followed by tart chardonnay. Leather, tingly carbonation. Dry finish. Great beer. Used the dregs to sour a gallon of homebrew hopefully it turn out good!

Finally got one! Bottle from Craft Ale House. Pours fairly blah yellow with a small white head that dissipates rather quickly. The aroma has a huge tart apple and grape, vinegar, light oak. The taste is big tart lemon, apple, and grape. There is a residual dry tartness that lingers on the tongue. This is a gorgeous sour.

Pours a brilliant hazy gold color with a small off white head. The smell is lively oak, grapes, sour coming through. The taste is funky, subtle wood, nicely sour and dry on the ending. Light and delicate with matching carbonation. A wonderful beer!

Bottle from Mike. Thanks man! Hay yellow pour. Funky aroma, sour lemon..tart somewhat gueze like. Taste is as billed, lots of funk doesnt scrape the palate, some oak and a vinous finish. Very well balanced, I could dink a lot of this if I had access to it.

Wee bottle many thx to adnielsen cons and shared 2013-10-26 Göteborg
AR: geuze, white wine
AP: hazy golden, wee ofwhite head
F: geuze, white wine, grapes, great tartness, great brew!

On tap. Foggy golden with an active body sustaining a small covering of cream. Aromas of white grape, light funk, citrus and a touch of vanilla. Tastes of white wine with light funk and maybe a touch of oak and wheat. Light-medium body is spritzy and dry.
Big thanks to tectactoe. Amazing smell with all the funk that comes along with this one. Nice sour flavor as well. Really good.

The bottle is from Batch 006.

A: Hazy Golden Straw, Light Foamy White Head, some Lacing

S: Brett, Chardonnay

T: Brett, Buttery, Sour Pear

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Buttery, Dry

Overall, a solid Wild Ale with a definite Brett presence and a sour but smooth taste to it.

Midly funky aromas accompanied with bright citrus. It puts pours a light golden color with tall thin head. The taste is lightly sweet and moderatly sour. Some oak and vanilla characteristics come throughout but the highlight is the full and complex acidic sour flavor that is bright and citrusy but also funky. It feels light bodied and soft on the palate. Quite a work of art.

Bottled May 30, 2013 (~4 months old).
Appearance: The body is beautifully clear with a golden sparkling body, the head is tall but thin and foamy with poor retention. The head settles into a white foamy coating.
Aroma: Brett is here, providing its signature funk that reminds me light barnyard aromas, tart lemon, and dry leather. I smell a prominent peach aroma that comes off mildly tart, but slightly sweet, along with green apples, with a subtle sweetness hidden in the background. This smells lovely, complex and inviting with a moderate presence.
Taste: The first sip comes off mildly sweet, with a dry, tart and fruity presence, lemons and leather come to mind. The intro reminds me of sweet peaches with mild overlying funk, accented by sour peach and lemon. The finish is mildly tart of green apple that finishes out nicely. Light oak notes add a dryness and a light vanilla presence on the finish, boy this is nice. The finish is dry and rather abrupt, leaving a slight acidity.Palate: Medium bodied and effervescent.
Overall: This is a great beer and I think that its drinking pretty near harmonious now. I think much longer would add too much Brett characteristic, while earlier may be a little too tame. I hope to try this again, I really enjoy it.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2015 On tap at Hops & Pie. Gold and hazy with a white head. Sour tart fruit, wine, light oak. Nice sour bite. Tasty.  4.0 ...Update:  375 ml bottled 2 months ago.  Very vinous with a strong chardonnay character.  This batch needs more time.  3.8

Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Funky aroma, citrus, lychee, white wine, barnyard, malts and funk. Sour flavour, citric acid, citrus, lemon juice, brett. Quite short finish, sour lemon juice, some grape notes. Nice, refreshing beer.
(From 37.5cL bottle shared @ decadent symmetry tasting. Batch 072712. Joint purchase between me and Eugene, thanks!)

Bottle at home, thanks to Rilester for muelling this back from CA, 03/10/13.
Hazed blonde with a good sized white head.
Nose is tarte lemon, apple skin, soured white grapes, musty, slightly dank woody tones.
Taste comprises tangy citrus zest, soured grape skins, funky, light acidic notes, dry rot, funky, lemon rind, grassy, barnyard, woody chardonnay notes.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, fairly smooth for a sour with a bitter citrus tang in the last hurrah.
Super drinkable sour !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Pours golden yellow with a nice thin off white head. Aroma on this is a pungent fruit funk, grapes, white wine and oak. Taste is light fruit, apple, pears, wine, oak. Tart light beer that finishes dry and refreshing. Amazing beer!

Pours from the bottle as a beautiful golden/yellow color. The aroma is phenomenal. It's got that tart , fruit smell., like apples. Taste follows the smell: very tart and dry. Smooth and thin beer. Very good.
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle. Bright gold with nice white head. Subtle funk, citrus, woody notes and dry white wine on the nose. Taste gives fairly juicy citrus and light tropical fruitiness, some funk, tart lemon juice, some dirty woody notes, bready malt, light spices. Good balance. Light degree of citric lightly funked-up tartness towards the end, plenty of dry white wine notes too. Incredibly dry finish. Another top sour from RR.

Pours hazy blonde with floating sediment and virtually no head. Nose is vague, little hints of sour apple, and not much else. Flavor is wonderful. Sour, green apple, white grape juice, with a finish of mild Brett and trace oak. Well balanced an delicious, just not much to the aroma.
Aroma is slight tart, white fruit such as apples and peaches. Front of palate is quite tart with a chardonnay like dry finish. Palate is very thin. Very good beer.

Joined purchase with Martinus. Thx! 375 ml. bottle sampled @ decadent symmetry tasting. Bottled on 21/07/2012. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Nose is that of juicy ripe lychee, faint white wine, touch oak, brett, it is clear that brett has been doing its job for a long time here, faint hops, dry, slightly fruity,Tate is juicy white grapes, integrated white wine, lychee, brett, well-done, touch oak, thinned by brett, slight spices,.. Fine carb. light & very dry. Very nice, expected a touch more from RR but this is still very nice.

This was one of those rare and perfect beers. 

Pours a clear, vibrant gold color with a pretty orange hue. Streaming effervescence. Looks like a glass of white wine or champagne except for the fat head of white foam. Delicate, tight bubbles that cling to the glass and fall off slowly to a cap and thick ring. Couldnt be any prettier. 

Nose is chardonnay wine. Has a nice crisp wine like scent with a touch of sour lemon. Brett and barnyard. Wet grass. The nose has just a touch of the oak and a dryness from the brett that also seems to be a little sour. The malt is faint on the nose and not much more than a breath of biscuit. As it warms the lemon becomes a little sweeter. 

Taste is divine. Its tart and sour. The mouth waters from the first sip. it tastes of the chardonnay and oak. The bubbles make it sparkle on the tongue. It has a mineral quality and a its a little edgy too. Bold and daring. The malt is light, fluffy and biscuity bread. The drink is dry and warming. So fruity, so juicy. 

This is one of the best beers you will have. The chardonnay character and the brett go so well together. The oak is understated but adds depth and the malt is superbly light. Crisp, fresh, billowing and ample. This is a beer you can linger over and really appreciate its indulgence.

Poured from the bottle into a tulip. Pours golden yellow with a white head that leaves amazing lacing on the glass. Aroma of lemon, bret and oak. Taste is very tart lemon and oak. Very refreshing without being too light. Excellent balance!
TAP at brewery..Pour is golden with a thing white head..Nose is nice barrel, funk, fruits, grape skin..Taste is dry, grape skin, dry oak, brett, nice sour tartness..very nice

Bottle. Pours a clear pale yellow body with a large, persistent creamy white head. Nose is smooth brett tones, with a moderate horse blanket-factor and more of the citric peel, lemon juice and sawdust approach. Hints of hay and tart red berries in the back. Taste is clean brett notes, citric peel, oak, sawdust and hints of sea buckthorn-like tart berries. Dry mouthfeel, moderate to high carbonation. Crisp, clean and very nice. The wine BA doesnt show much except in some dry wooden tones, I guess the strong brett presence takes over. Still, a really fine sour beer in all respects.

Pours blonde. Flavor is comprised primarily of sharp, acidic lemon tempered by light oak and chardonnay character. Super dry on the finish. Not the most complex of their sours but one of the most focused, controlled sours Ive ever had the pleasure of drinking.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2013 Tap at the brewpub. Clear light orange pour. Tart and sour lemon, oak, and white grapes. Crisp on the tongue. Fantastic!

Really at odds over this one. Puckery sour with a strong lemon bent. The clean lemon sour of the beer is somewhat unique to me and stands out. Yet it kind of overwhelms everything else. At a loss for finding the wood or other flavors within it. Nice mouthfeel and excellent carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Clear, pale yellow with a frothy, clean white head. Aromas of fruit possibly from the chardonnay barrels, oak, funk, and yeast. Flavor is sweet and tart fruits, oak, yeast, and a dry funky end.
Bottle. Blond sour with heavy chardonnay notes and french oak from the barrel aging.

Draught @ Russian River Brewing, Santa Rosa, CA
Pours clear deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, tart, funk, white wine and oak. Taste is light sweet and medium sour with a vineous and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. It is a clear, golden beer, topped by a small, white head. Brett aroma, lemon and some funky hints. Slightly tart on the palate, with some bitterness and a pleasant funky brett touch. Full to medium body, soft carbonation. Lasting finish. A nice palate cleansing beer, thats for sure. 130806

On tap at brewpub. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma funk, some lemon, malt , some grains and grapes. Flavor is sweet and sour with some funk, lemon and white wine. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy deep golden with lively carbonation. Musty tart/sour fruit with acetic tanginess and woody notes. Undeniably sour and slightly lactic, but balanced by nice pale grape sweetness with notable oaky smoothness. I liked the balance of flavours here.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Batch 003-Pours hazy orange with a creamy, off white head. Aroma of pear, funky, wood, basement. Effervescent with a slightly tart, sour flavor maybe even smokey, and a dry mouthfeel. While I cant pick out a distinct flavor there is definitely no mistaking that this was aged in chardonnay barrels. Amazing beer.

Golden and effervescent with a thin white head. Fine bubbles. Aroma is tart fruit, grape, wine, and some green apple. Taste is heavy with Chardonnay character, funky, with green apple and grape skins. The finish is puckering and delicious. This rating is over. The name is suitable as this brew is overly tempting to drink quickly. Amazing!!
bottle. batch 009. pours bright gold with fluffy white head that fades fast! big wine aroma. lots of acidity and citrus fruit.
Carbonated!! Mild. Grapes, Belgian yeast; minimally intrusive malts and grain. Grassy, hints of farmhouse ales, tasty. Might be the only time I've enjoyed Temptation.

Pours hazy golden yellow with light white head. Aroma of lemon and light oak and funky smell. Taste of nice belgian malt with sour grapes and great carbonation up front, on the backend of the sip i get an oak and funky bret taste. The beer isnt to acidic but leaves a marvelous citrus/grape refreshing aftertaste. Overall a great sour that isnt to overpoweringly sour and enjoyable on a hot summer day.

bottle shared by fred82, thanks! batch 05X1F. pours clear pale yellow with a minimal white head, some retention and nice lacing. white grapes, must, light acetic notes, juicy chardonnay, fruity - pears and grapes. moderate funk and light acidity balancing honeyed and chewy pale malts. average carbonation, medium body - oily, lightly acidic and citrusy very dry finish. excellent!
bottle. Pale golden with two finger head. Very bright and tart. Fruity, almost ciderish. Excellent.

Batch 05X1E

A - Slightly hazed golden body with a bright white head.

S - Sweet grapes, green apples, tart berries, lots of dry dusty wood, lemons, some grassy potpourri spices that remind me of a hobby lobby. The brett and chardonnay aroma really starts taking over as it warms.

T - Tart grapes, crisp green apples, and lemon dance on the tongue creating a nice crisp tartness. A light dusty funk appears mid palate finishing crisp and tart with some snappy lemon acidity.

M - Light body, effervescent carbonation that turns smooth at the end, nice tartness with a crisp dry finish.

Ive been sitting on this for almost 2 years but its felt like 5! I had to crack it open tonight.
Very light and crisp with nice wood notes. Funkiness was there but not over the top. Sour but not puckering. The chardonnay is pronounced but is nice. Just a subtle, but very well done sour.

Serving type: bottle

07-28-2012

Shared with a friend that has never had a sour before. Pours a clear orange color with a white frothy head. Smell of sour wine and oak. Taste is sour white wine with slight fruitiness. Very good sour but not my favorite from Russian river.

[bottle]
Vinous white grape and sour aroma with some oak butterscotch. Almost clear light orange under a patchy white cover. Winey sour flavour with a pleasant malt backbone to balance the sour. Complex fruitiness: raspberry, cherry, white grape. Dry and sour but not over the top. Light body, high carbonation, very clean finish.

P: A golden biright color, almost pale straw, translucent with lots of light shining through the edges, Has a one finger head that settles. A: Oak, pear skin and apple skin, chardonnay, wet hay, and brett. T: Oak, sour lemons, wine, hay, mangos, and sour green apples. M: light, medium to high carbonation and the perfect amount of sourness and just super easy to drink. O: I first had this like 3 or 4 yrs ago (one of my first sours) and it was amazing. I had this again, finally and is freakin mind blowing.
Sampled at DLD 2013.  It poured a golden color with a white head and tons of carbonation. The aroma was very yeasty and bready. The taste was very dry and tart, with sour apples. Nothing but awesome.

Bottle from a trade, I wish we could get this "locally"! Pours really pale blonde with a nice fluffy blanket of foam that leaves some pretty intense lacing. Really nice stuff we have here! Aroma is like a damp basement with wet grains and mustiness. Taste is sour of course with only the slightest acetic character, like any good gueuze really. It feels really good and is mighty quenching. Awesome stuff! Doesnt pale in comparison to the  top tier gueuzes!

750ml bottle, shared by Nate. Hazy yellow - orange color. Little off-white head. Some decent lace. Really oaky, tart, lightly citrusy nose. Big tart taste. Medium to bigger body. Light orange-like citrus, but thats hard to notice under all the tart oak. Bright, lighter carbonation. Light viscosity in the finish, bit more dry overall. Great stuff

750 ml bottle to snifter (Batch 4; thanks Nate). Looks good; a hazy orange with off-white head that dissipates into lacing fairly quickly. Smells good too; semi-sweet, tart, and funky. Tastes like it smells with a nice, lively mouthfeel. Good stuff!

This beer uses "Brett", a yeast strain that I HATE! But, when I opened the bottle I kept an open mind. Glad I did, because this beer is amazing!!! The beer is sour. I mean lip sucking sour, and I love that. As it heats up, the sourness subsides, and the true flavor in this beer comes out. The next time I am in San Diego, I will grab a few of these to cellar. I bet this just gets better with age. Well done, Russian River!
Mild sour. Nice underlying fruit flavors. Sourness quickly decays, making for a very drinkable beer.

Pours a cloudy golden with a large white head. The aroma is mild with bready yeasty notes but the barrel and the Chardonnay bugs come through very clearly. Great transition from sweetness to immediate tartness on the palate with a vinous finish. Killer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from trade.  Yellow with bright white head.  high carbonation.  I know this is a sour - but this tasted really sour...

A beautiful beer. Vibrant. White head. Aroma is of tart fruits. Bright. Palate is so full and velvety. I loved how this flowed and coated my mouth. Tart. Finished dry. Almost "spicy". Really refreshing and clean

Bottle; Batch 6. Somewhat subdued and sticky aroma of Chardonnay, Brett funk, barnyard, lemongrass, and leather. Beautiful slightly cloudy golden color with tiny, foamy white head. Tart, prickly flavor of oak, light vinous tones, touch of lemon, and a quick bitter bite of hops before the taste falls completely off the table. Light body with a tart, abrupt finish; nicely carbed. Not my favorite Russian River sour, but a nice beer nonetheless.

Bottle pours cloudy light orange with quickly dissipating white head. Funk, barnyard, horse blanket, light fruit, orange, a little bit of oak. Extremely sour, moderate sweetness. Medium, lively body. I love a beer where the last sip is just as good as the first. Masterful.

The beer has chunks!! sporting a foamy head and yellow colour. There is a funk/soil aroma, infected soureness on the nose. More sour than I thought it would be and also has a sweetness in a lemon pie sort of way. It has a tannic finish which i enjoy alot as well. this is great stuff.

Hazy golden pour with a short white head that sticks around nicely. The nose is full of antiseptic, mustard (???), wood and funky earthiness. Lightly sour on the palate with lots of woodiness, fruit, that mustard note again, light funk.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: nice head.
Nose: fruit, citrus, brett, chardonnay
Taste: the sourness is mild in this beer, but very good, citrus
thx Joris for sharing

Overall one of my favorite RR sours..  

Oak and wine really comes through with a slightly sour finish.  Not over powering sour like Beat 5, could drink one after another.

On tap pours a slightly hazy golden color with medium white head with pretty good lacing. Smells of apple, pears, Belgian yeast and slight wood from the barrels used. Tastes of all the same things in the nose. Mouthfeel is medium and slightly surupy with a semi dry finish. Overall a nice belgian sour with plenty of flavor and the wine barrels used did it some good.
From a bottle shared at home.  Pours a cloudy pale gold with a thick, fine head.  Lemon and bread in the nose.  Tart lemon and some funky yeast notes.  Nicely balanced and  tasty.

Pours golden yellow with minimal head. Good lacing. Tastes of lemon, pears, and apple. Nice sour taste. Refreshing to drink. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle - corked & caged 375 ml - Night of the Titans 2013) Clear golden pour with a bubbly and fizzy white head. Sour and tart aroma with a very light woody sweetness. Smells great and tastes even better. Big sour flavor mixed with a light sweet note, most likely from the wood. Blends well together and leaves that really delicious sour and tart taste lingering for a long time.

Bottle. Pours a golden, orange clear body, small head. Great aroma, but a better taste. Well balanced sourness and fruitiness, yet, less depth than for example RRs Supplication. Nonetheless, a very fine example of soury craft in the world of beer.

Bottle. Very light color, looks like a light beer. The aroma is crisp sour. The taste is all sour. Average. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Bottle: Thanks Steve: Vintage 2010:
Medium to smaller sized white to off white head on top of a clear yellow colored beer.
Smell brett, wild yeast, ash, fruits like apricot, sulphur, cellar and a nice wet stone.
Taste is good and pretty complex mix of: good tart with some hints of yeast, chalk, grapes, berries, cellar, apricot, wet stone, wild yeast.
Aftertaste is light tart with some grains and yeast.
Low carbo, watery light creamy mouthfeel, good medium to lightly fuller body and a light creamy texture.
Quite 1 dimensional, but still good enough!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
375 ml C + C bottle into a tulip glass. Bottled 07/27/12 so nearly six months old at this point. Thanks Wes!

A - Pours an initially clear golden amber body. The second pour is obviously quite hazy with some sediment. Massive fluffy bone white head fills the rest of the glass but dies down quickly leaving behind a gorgeous one finger cap. Sticky and soapy lacing with long retention coats the glass after every sip. 

S - Starts off with huge notes of brettanomyces. Barnyard musk, hay, and oak. Layers of fruit; mainly lemons, overripe pears and grape skins. The finish is powdery and dry with a touch of blue cheese. The white wine barrel adds such a great fruit character. Just phenomenal. 

T - Crisp and lively. Sour lemons, ripe pear juice, and tart green grapes. Oak and a musk take over on the finish. Lactic and very tart. Finishes nearly dry. Not over the top sour.

M - Medium bodied with high carbonation. Drinks very easily.

O - Very nice AWA. The aroma is just perfect. Definitely draws some parallels with brett heavy Belgian Pales and the Chardonnay barrel adds a subtle but well implemented angle.
Pours a pale yellow, aroma is yeasty/brett. Nice sweetness followed by sour notes.

Batch 006 thanks to adnielsen! Pours a blondish golden color with a finger of fizzy sticky foam. On the nose its subtle yet complex... vinous fruit, bits of mineral, barnyard brett, pineapple, watermelon and a touch of oak.  The palate is light and complex with nice tropical notes of pineapple, mango, granny smith apple. Great touch of acidity and tartness but well balanced and rounded out beautifully by the oak undertones....

On tap at the brewpub, served in a stem glass. Pours clear golden with a small white head that fades slowly and leaves lots of fine lace. On the nose, there are soft notes of sour fruit, along with flowers, oak, chardonnay grapes and Brett funk. The flavour is moderately sour with soft fruity notes paired with an accent of sweet malts. There is subtle oak and very subtle Brettanomyces. The finish is long and softly tart with a chardonnay oakiness. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a smooth, watery texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a great sour with a beautiful white wine character. Very tasty. 2012-02-19
375ml corked bottle. Pours a clear gold with fine bubble white head. Delicate palate the pleasant bacteria character complements very mild maltiness. Impressive.

Draft at Bigwood 12/6/12 [5 of 11].
Aroma: belgian golden ale, yeast, malty sweetness. Like a dubbel with extra spices (nutmeg, cloves). 
Appearance: pale gold. One finger worth of nice frothy white head. Crystal clear. Nice but irregular lacing. 
Taste: big sour up front (unexpected from aroma). Followed by noticeable hop bitterness before giving way to a sweeter finish in line with aroma. The transition is jarring, and not as harmonious as I've come to expect from RR.
Palate: medium body, nice carbonation. 
Overall: this is still pretty great, but isn't in the same league as the others (1-4) I'm tasting side-by-side. 

Note from Nick: "this is the best thing to ever come out of a chardonnay barrel. Write that down."

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a corked and caged 375 ml bottle. Pours a very pale gold with a velvety white head of foam. The aroma is lemony, green apple, oaky. Taste is more of a subdued sourness. Its kind of a mellow beer. Dry finish. Sanctification was better, in my opinion.
Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours golden with white head.  Nice thin lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and oak aroma.  Taste is tart malt and oak.
perhaps my favorite RR. I am a fan of quality oaked Chardonnay so perhaps that contributes. Light, balanced acidity and sour, oak is there but not over-powering. drink this all day.
Pale blond colour. Aroma features wax and white wine. Body is thin. Flavour is very much like a sparkling white wine. The sharp acidity catches the back of the throat.

On tap.
Deep golden brew with some white head.  Nose is vinous, fruity, sour, woody.  Flavor is earthy and slightly funky.
Excellente bière, combinant lacidité du vin, des bretts, des fruits et des agrumes.

Bottle 375ml [Batch 6].
Pours clear blond with low white head. High lacing. Aroma is of citrus, malt, white wine, bretts. Taste is of citrus, malt, acid, sourness, bretts. Palate: just above thin. Overall: Very good, serious offering. Not too cloying.

Bottle (375 ml) batch 006. Traded by jp7161, thanks Joseph! Clear golden with a small creamy white head and superb lacing. Aroma of white wine, fruits (lemon, grapes, pineapple), brettanomyces and slight floral notes. Taste is also of white wine, brettanomyces, fruits and wood. Moderate sourness and slight sweetness, which is perfectly integrated. Mouthfeel is winey and slightly dry. Near perfect balance, great complexity and incredibly drinkable. Great use of chardonnay and brett together. A masterpiece!
Slightly sour aroma with lots of white wine notes.  Cloudy orange pout.  Taste is pretty wild.  Strange burn in your mouth.  Very sour but not overly tasty.  The taste is a little funky.

375ml bottle dated 27th July 2012,thanks Shaun.Good looking golden coloured ale with a thin white head which only lasted a few seconds.Aromas of wine and sour fruits were well in evidence as was wet wood.Sour fruits also came through very much so in the taste and included apples and grapes.Nicely carbonated too.Altogether a lovely smooth and sour sipping beer which all too soon had gone.
Big sour lemon yeast funk with a bit of earthy notes. Has a similar taste with a nice sour pucker finish.
Aroma is a fruity white dessert wine.  Looks a bit like sparking white wine (or a bubblier light beer).  Sour apple flavor...dries out and finishes a bit woody.

2012 bottle, thanks to fredrik_!
Hazy pale golden with a white head leaving lacing.
Aroma: yeasty, tart, green apples.
Taste: green apples, lemons, brett, very tart, dry.
Medium bodied, sharp carbonation.
Yeah, this is nice enough, but not really my thing.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 November 16, 2012 bottle shared by Brandon.  Cloudy yellow pour with some head that lasted and lacing.  Aroma had some earthy funk, white wine and wood.  Taste was consistent with aroma.  Very easy to drink and nicely balanced.

December 31, 2014 - had another bottle.  My initial description seems to be appropriate for this bottle as well.  No change to ratings.  This bottle was batch 5.

Bottle batch 006 thanks to timfoolery: Poured an orange with thin white head. Aroma is woodsy and fruit. Taste is full of wood and tingly brett, sour edges of fruit. Over all mild which I enjoy in a sour/wild ale.

Bottle received in trade.

A very good sour. Really liking the dryness in this. Would gladly drink it again.

375 ml bottle - sampled at our motohome tour in California. Pours clear light yellow, with a tiny, quickly dissolving head. Aroma is very refined: vinious like a dry German-style Pfalz Riesling wine, oak, elderflower, apricot and citrus. Light body with a gentle acidity countered with nice carbonation. Dry finish. This is again an amazing trick - the Russian River Sours are just perfect!

Aroma of tart gewurtz, sour dough and a floral perfume.  Pours bright amber with no head.  Taste is nice and tart with great notes of sweet white grape, funky cellar, and sour dough.  Great hint of oak on the finish.  Great sour!
Aroma is slight tart, white fruit such as apples and peaches.  Front of palate is quite tart with a chardonnay like dry finish.  Palate is very thin.  Very good beer.

On tap at Russian River.  Golden appearance with medium head and retention. Nose is Chardonnay up front with hints of lemon peel in the background. Taste is wonderfully sour, causing an explosion of the salivary glands. I was visiting from Florida and realized that this a rare treat!
On tap at Russian River in Santa Rosa, medium disappearing head, subtle sour finish. Might like this better from the bottle with some time on it.

375 ml bottle served in a FFF teku glass. Batch 006.

A: Pours a clear golden amber color with frothy white head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thick ring and thin cap.

S: A great lemon tartness is there initially on the nose. A dry white wine with some light green grape.

T: Great lactic sourness. Really puckering at the jowls. Tart lemon, white wine, white grapes and fresh green grape tartness. Unripened pear Dried oak with a light barrel sweetness. Definite funkiness in the periphery. 

M: Light bodied with a drying, sweet finish. Nice prickly carbonation as well.

O: The lightness is great and the carb is perfectly spritzy. Great tartness with a nice lactic sourness.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-13-2012

Pours a hazy slight orange, mostly yellow straw color from the bottle. Ample head. Aromas of citrus, straw, loads of funk, tart fruit. Taste is barnyard, Brett, deep funk, sour, tart, oak, white wine. This is amazing. Wow! Super dry, funky sour that is to be worshipped. This completes the RR trifecta of sour ales. This beer is flawless.
Pours cloudy yellow.. Aroma of soap and some fruit... Taste is very sour.. Some apple.. Diffrent style beer for me but diddnt hate it..

Haven't had a beer like this before. Poured from the bottle - yellowish with fluffy white head. Couldn't pick up aroma. Very sour taste indeed.  Smooth tho and not over the top.  First sip scared me, enjoyed it more and more throughout the bottle

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 Pale golden color, good lacing. Aroma is flowery/fruity, kind of sweet tart candy, but with Chardonnay notes. Flavor is sour citrus fruit up front, oak, grainy malt, fades to a light lactic note. Tingly palate.

On tap at Monks in Philly. Pours a hazy straw yellow color. Minimal white head. Aroma is grapey funk, tartness, barnyard, some oak. Nice complex aroma. Taste is nice and balanced, earthy, citrusy, barnyard, grape, óak. After drinkiing a bit the sourness mellows and adds to the nice complexity of the beer. Nice quite complex sour but not one of my favorites from RR.

Aroma is medium intensity with notes of lactic sourness and white wine fruitiness.  The taste is phenomenal with a very subtle bitterness up front, followed by a gradual lactic sourness that eventually comes on really strong.  The sourness is followed by white wine character, acetic sourness and a touch of funky brett (I think).  It leaves a lingering white wine character in your mouth that leaves you wondering if youre sipping beer or wine.

Tap. Pours clear light amber with a medium white head that leaves good lacing. Aroma is tart apple/citrus, brett, Flavor is moderate sweet, medium tart, notes of citrus, white wine, sour apple. Quite nice.

Bottle dated 7/27/12. Pours a gorgeous pale gold with a slight white head. Aroma is a perfect mix of funk and sourness. Reminiscent of aged cheese, ripe fruits, and wine. Taste is really great.
